data.title: [Keybindings] Make note about alt/option key for OS X
data.body:
Is it worth noting in the documentation at https://atom.io/docs/latest/behind-atom-keymaps-in-depth, and in the Keymap file (~/.atom/keymap.cson) that custom keybindings should use 'alt' rather than 'opt' in their commands? 

Thanks for a great project!

Versions:
atom: 0.189.0
OS: Mac OS X

data.title: Multiple file requesters on File -> Open File on v0.189.0
data.body: I'm using Debian 64 bit.  I just discovered that one can go to the file menu and choose Open File and a file requester opens.  One can leave that requester open and go back to the file menu and choose Open File again, and another file requester will open **behind** the first one.  This can be especially problematic because the the first file requester (including the cancel button) is non-responsive.

data.title: Exporting Atom application menu with dbus exposes an issue libdbusmenu and plasma-desktop
data.body:
For some reason only Atom so far triggers this that's why i'm reporting this here too. 
I have an bug open also @ https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/libdbusmenu/+bug/1439627
## Issue

So the issue is that when i launch atom with exporting menus to appmenu in KDE: https://launchpad.net/plasma-widget-menubar

When launching atom the menu's are unresponsive and flicker and plasma-desktop eats memory like a madman. ~1GiB in few seconds and seen it above ~3GiB.

Looking at **xsession-errors** i found that it was complaining:
`void DBusMenuImporterPrivate::updateActionProperty(QAction*, const QString&, const QVariant&): Unhandled property update "children-display"`

Found similar issue with path: https://bugs.launchpad.net/globalmenu-extension/+bug/779344

I patched it and the error is gone however the issue remains with menus being unresponsive and plasma eating memory. Launhing plasma in terminal i found these errors spamming when launching atom.

`void DBusMenuImporter::slotGetLayoutFinished(QDBusPendingCallWatcher*): "The ID supplied 9709 does not refer to a menu item we have"`

`void DBusMenuImporter::slotGetLayoutFinished(QDBusPendingCallWatcher*): "The ID supplied 9710 does not refer to a menu item we have"`

**_--SNIP--**_

`void DBusMenuImporter::slotGetLayoutFinished(QDBusPendingCallWatcher*): "Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken."`

`void DBusMenuImporter::slotGetLayoutFinished(QDBusPendingCallWatcher*): "Did not receive a reply. Possible causes include: the remote application did not send a reply, the message bus security policy blocked the reply, the reply timeout expired, or the network connection was broken."`

data.title: 32 bit distrubutions
data.body: There should be binaries for 32-bit. A lot of potential users may not be able to build from source.

data.title: Copypaste fail
data.body: Copy and paste inside the Atom works. When you insert one Atom to another application it hangs up for a second and nothing sticks. Then, the clipboard is cleared. When you paste from another application in the Atom, the Atom sometimes falling, sometimes inserts. Change the frequency, once every hour or two, once every few inserts.

data.title: startup time
data.body:
since the early versions on atom this version's start up time is very much i know all these features take some time to load but this is quite too much , which is not good for text editor . 
please fix this start up time issue. 
thanks in advance

data.title: Public Continuous Integration
data.body:
Closes #6222  :green_heart: :green_heart: :green_heart:
- [x] Setup Travis
  - [x] OS X setup. [You can see a passing build here.](https://travis-ci.org/as-cii/atom/builds/57160743)
  - [x] `script/cibuild` didn't work out of the box on Travis; on my OS X machine it doesn't work either, [showing the same failures](https://travis-ci.org/as-cii/atom/builds/57005243). @kevinsawicki: any idea why we're getting those errors? `run-specs` task is not really reliable on my machine and I usually run tests through `apm test`: do you think we can keep it in Travis as well?
  - [x] Linux setup (to test builds only, as per current `cibuild` behavior).
    - [x] Ask Travis to enable multi-os setup, [as it is disabled by default](http://docs.travis-ci.com/user/multi-os/)

Any idea or suggestion is most welcome, as usual. Thank you! :pray: 

/cc: @atom/non-github-maintainers @atom/owners

data.title: Crash while editing markdown files
data.body:
Atom crashed multiple times while editing markdown files with markdown preview plugin.
I am using OS X Yosemite 10.10.2 and Atom version 0.189.0

data.title: :art: :green_heart: Fixed the test script.
data.body: Also removed duplicated logic to run grunt.

data.title: Added an option to disable keymaps for packages.
data.body:
Introduces a config entry called packagesWithKeymapsDisabled that allows users to disable specific packages' keymaps.

![atom-disable-keymaps-for-packages](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/547186/6989279/685b23f0-da62-11e4-8038-6e74e4299f2c.gif)

data.title: Auto raise
data.body: When started from another application, e.g. windows explorer with "Open with Atom", the existing Atom process opens the file, but Atom window doesn't raise (or restore). This is however actually almost always the case when a file is double clicked in Explorer.

data.title: Use of Chrome 41 in Atom 0.189.0 breaks cursor controls for Ubuntu 14.04 in virtualized environments.
data.body: Almost certainly because of this Chrome issue:  https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=465660 (see also https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=456222, https://www.virtualbox.org/ticket/13968).   Didn't have this problem in Atom in this environment before the upgrade to use Chrome 41.  Makes Atom very difficult to use in this environment.

data.title: Revert "Add asar support in Atom"
data.body: Reverts atom/atom#5382 because of https://github.com/atom/symbols-view/issues/89

data.title: Multiple String selection bottleneck
data.body:
Although perhaps uncommon to most, I use the Multiple String selection quite a bit and noticed that it can choke quite easily/quickly when the same string is used multiple times. 

For example take the following CSV:
https://gist.github.com/TeckniX/ddcacc78ce235d7702c0

Trying to do a multiple string selection on `,` and then typing out changes will be un-bearably slow (aka lagg and app seems frozen). Using the same file, Sublime barely breaks a sweat, yet the technique is the same.

data.title: Fix screen/buffer range error in paragraph cursor motions
data.body:
Fixes atom/vim-mode#602
Fixes atom/vim-mode#496

data.title: Fix `deleteLine()` when multiple selections are on the same line
data.body:
Closes #6108.

Before these changes, when a line contained multiple selections and `deleteLine()` was called, two lines would have been deleted instead of just one. This happens because, when the line containing the first selection is deleted, the other selection doesn't get destroyed but it simply moves.

This PR tries to fix this by merging selections that have intersecting rows. However, I do feel like there may be some other elegant solutions to this: I am thinking to something like `Marker` invalidation, for example.

/cc: @nathansobo

data.title: Editor crashes when I copy into Atom 0.189 on Linux
data.body:
This may well be related to #6234 but I am experiencing a crash in the other direction. 

I am on Arch Linux. When I seek to copy into a markdown file (a pandoc reference of format [xyz2000]) I get a white screen and a notification that the window has crashed.

data.title: Atom crashes on HiDPI Linux
data.body:
Atom version:
Tested on 0.189.0 and git commit ffa6d4a

Environment:
Arch Linux x86_64 non-testing, all updates installed
GNOME Shell 3.14.3 (and 3.16.0) on xorg-server 1.17.1-4 and xf86-video-intel (although also reproducible on NVIDIA X server via primus)
Lenovo Y50-70 with 2160p display (HiDPI scaling is necessary for a usable UI in most applications)
Macbook 2,1 (found that Atom crashes when scaled, does not crash when interface is not scaled)

Steps:
1. Enable HiDPI scaling with 

``` shell
gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface scaling-factor 2
```
1. Run atom, either normally or in safe mode
2. Open two or more tabs
3. Attempt to switch two tabs by dragging
4. Wait for GNOME to restart

Behavior:
The GNOME Shell and Atom crash. GNOME restarts several seconds later
